result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason G. Fornwalt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
** Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Compose letter of apology to Jessica Larson as instructed in the PSI.  May not possess drug paraphernalia.  May not consume any alcohol and no alcohol in residence.  Do not associate with drug users, dealers or drug house.  Complete treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney John Ward.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Sentencing arguments made.  DE is sentenced to 15 years in the WSP forthwith and is consecutive to any other sentence; 5 years Initial Confinement followed by 10 years Extended Supervision.  DE is not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Sentence credit to be determined and submitted by Atty Ward for court to review and approve.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney John Ward.  Clerk: PT
Amended Information filed by the State and case is resolved.   Deft. pleads Guilty as amended; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 4/23/15 at 10:30 AM.

NO RECORD TAKEN:   Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared w/ Attorney John Ward.  Clerk: PT
Case remains scheduled for trial on Monday.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA T Binger.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.    Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney John Ward.  Clerk: PT
Case is not resolved and scheduling order given to parties.  Jury Status on 2/9/15 at 1:00 PM.  Jury Trial on 2/23/15 at 8:30 AM.

Attorney Patrick Anderson appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney John Ward.  Clerk: PT
Atty Ward states he is waiting for additional discovery from the State requests an adjournment; no objection by the State.  FPT adj. to 9/18/14 at 3:00 PM.
Final pre-trial on August 7, 2014 at 1:30 p.m.  Date changed from 7/31/14 at 10:30 at request of the State, scheduled into the week of the correct ADA (Jason Zapf).

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. John A. Ward. Clerk LE. KPD Det. Keith Dumesic sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Ward. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 4. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 7-31-14 @ 10:30am. Bond continued.
Deft has retained Atty. John Ward on 6/24/14.

119pm  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody (writ) and appeared in court w/ Attorney John Ward.  Clerk: LE  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on 7/2/14 @ 1030am.  Warrant vacated.  $100,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
Return on a writ  -  Tiffany in J/S records notified to cancel warrant (J/S records stated they do not have the warrant)
and witness list filed by the State
